Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing place. Such a great location!”
Reviews.Author: thursowick
Reviews.Content: Wow. Loved this place. Five minute walk from the main train station (Santa Lucia) down a tiny little alley way. So picturesque, so Venetian! All the staff were very kind (even when we couldn't communicate, we somehow seemed to figure everything out) and helpful. The owner (I think) spoke very good English and was very nice. Our rooms were clean and lovely. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! Plus, the windows look out on the picturesque alleyway with lovely wooden shutters, stone walkways, etc. We want to go back there already!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Seems to be a family owned hotel - small and cozy. Staff was extremely friendly - allowed for us to keep our luggage there even after checking out and they even let us borrow an umbrella for the surprising rain that morning! The only problem is that the walls are extremely thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: camfam6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for a quick visit to Venice and thought it was the perfect location. It was a short walk from the train station and in the middle of lots of shops and restaurants. Our room was clean and comfortable and included breakfast. Although they say that you can only get wifi in the lobby, we were able to get it in our room on the third floor. This hotel was a bargain for Venice, and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: otubo
Reviews.Content: Clean and big rooms, great breakfast for just â‚¬ 5 per person. (breads, croissants, milk, coffee, tea and juice) extremely confortable. Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but little more”
Reviews.Author: bishclone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice at the end of September in what felt like unseasonably hot weather. The hotel was fine and seemed clean but the service was basic and my husband and I were rather caught out on the first few nights by the mosquitos that came to feast on us. Wifi was available but only in the lobby which was disappointing and there could have been more information - we weren't told about breakfast at check in so assumed there wouldn't be any! The breakfast was fine. Service was prompt but lacked warmth. A real plus for the hotel was the location close to the train and bus station (only a short walk over the modern bridge from the bus station) which was preferable to trying to get luggage on the vaporetto! However, the path down to the hotel was being worked on when we visited and there were a few choice smells emanating from beneath the ply board covering the work!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MirianFDias
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 nights/ 3 full day visit to beautiful Venice. The hotel is situated close to the Ferrovia "boat station", very handy to take the boats in almost any direction. Size of the rooms is small but still reasonable, very basic. No airco in our room, so we had to sleep with the windows open and the noise starts around 7am, so if you dont get a room with airco or if you dont bring ear plugs don't expect to sleep too much. Breakfast hour was very short from 8 till 10am only. Breakfast was simple but they diligently topped up anything that was running off quickly. Choices were some croissants, cereals, yogurts, jams, small triangular cheese and some juice. Thats it... and coffee/milk. I found it very expensive for a 2 start hotel, but couldn't find something cheaper and nice, since in Venice everything is so expensive. For a 2 start hotel doh the quality of the service/rooms/breakfast was not bad. I would try to book a hotel as soon as possible (months if possible) to get something better for the same money, we were a bit late booking (only 3 weeks in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Reasonable Price. A nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: HappyPengu
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned that it would be difficult to find this hotel, given the nature of the streets in Venice. However, with luggage and all, we got to the hotel within 5 minutes of walking out of the train station - you basically turn left once you exit the station, stay on the left side of the street, and turn left again into an alleyway when you see an '@' sign on the left side of the street, and voila! The hotel was quite nice and cosy. The room itself was clean and had all the basic necessities. There was also an adequate selection of breakfast choices (but only go for it if your booking already includes breakfast). Only minor disturbance was the free wi-fi, which only worked (for us, at least) when you're in the lobby. Our room was on the 3rd floor so it was a bit of a pain having to go up and down and stairs every time we wanted to use the internet. Then again, we weren't in the Venice to use the internet! I also didn't see an elevator in the hotel (although this could be my oversight) so fingers crossed that if you have a lot of luggage upon arrival, you get a room on the bottom floor. Given the location, I would happily stay there again the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris994
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August and although the rooms were small, they were very comfortable and clean. You couldn't hear any noise from the streets, so this was another positive. No elevator, but only 3 floors so if you get on the 3rd floor like we did, it really wasn't too bad getting the luggage up the stairs. It was a little difficult to find when we first arrived. Breakfast was very simple, croissants, cereal, packaged cheese, yogurt.. We would stay here again as the price was reasonable and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exetergourmets
Reviews.Content: There's not a lot to write home about the Caprera Hotel. Its well located for the railway station, is clean and comfortable. The rooms are not massive, some are bigger than others (11, 21 and 31 look the largest) and the bathrooms are fine. Staying there in hot and humid August we wished that we had forked out more for somewhere with air conditioning - as even the nights were uncomfortable in the heat. The hotel could make a little more effort with breakfast, which disappointed. The coffee was horrible and some fresh bread would be nice. If you are on a budget, staying in expensive Venice then this is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great location - we will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCari
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel with my 9 year old son since our friends we were visiting were staying at an apartment in the same district. The hotel was close to the train station, water bus dock, shops and restaurants. The owners and staff were very friendly and helpful. I felt safe and well looked after here which is important for a mom and child traveling alone in a foreign country like Venice (I speak no Italian). Oh and keep in mind that some hotels in Venezia dont take kids!! The room was clean and in good repair. The breakfast and coffee were good and we had internet access. They were also nice to my friends and their kids and dogs when they came by (the hotel has a black cocker that lives there). It was so hot and humid in Venezia that I would have loved to have an air conditioner in our room so I dinged them a star for that but call and ask, maybe they have rooms with air conditioning like the lobby does. Happy Traveling!

Reviews.Title: “A little quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: irondoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiacee for two nights at the end of July. On of the really nice things about this hotel is it's proximity to the train station. Although we arrived by bus from the airport, it's only a bit further of a walk from the bus drop off point (just up over a bridge and you're at the train station!). Then a short walk down ...... Which is crowded with tourist, only a short way until you turn left on to the small alley marked by an @ symbol. And you're there. It took only an hour from deplaning, to get the local bus (5euros), to walk in the front door of the hotel. We were a bit before the checkin at noon, but we were able to leave our luggage, grab a lunch and our room was ready promptly at noon. The proprieters were helpful and friendly, often siting out in the quiet alley at the entrance reading. The lobby is small, but comfortable with free wifi. Our room was small, but normal for Europe. There was ac and a large en suite bathroom with a bidee. The shower was small but clean. There are no lifts, so plan on walking if your on the 3rd floor like us. But you will walk everywhere in Venice! The room was comfortable and quiet opening onto a small balcony looking out to the quaint alley. No view to speak of though. Breakfast is also included and served in the lobby. Typical euro Bfast with cereal, croissants, coffee, and oj, served until 10 for us late risers! It was a great way to get a off to a good start in venice! Even when we checked out, the proprietor was kind enough to let us leave our bags there because our departing train wasn't until 4:30! Thank you hotel carpera for making us welcome in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Livelife88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only this week and was overall pleased with my stay. The hotel is only a few minutes from the train station and is close to lots of restaurants. They have free wifi but the connection doesn't really work while you're in the rooms. Breakfast is free and while there's not alot to choose from it's enough. Only downside is that the rooms have no aircon and if you keep the windows open heaps of mossies get in so the rooms are really hot!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price for Venice”
Reviews.Author: MoMurphy
Reviews.Content: If you are the type of traveler like me that does not sit in your Hotel, then this is a great place to stay. By train, you make the left out of the Station and you are there in minutes. Located just off the main route, it is a very quiet location. This family owned and operated Hotel was a great find for our 5 day trip, as we were able to walk everywhere. Alberto and Marco the two brothers really try to do everything for you and point you in the right direction. The rooms are clean and updated. The only downside is some of the single rooms do not have air conditioning, so keep that in mind if you are coming in the middle of summer as we did. They also offer discounts if you use their web site. All in all, having been told how expensive Venice can be, and it is, this place will help stretch your travel dollar to use elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: cca77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group (32 people) in March 2011. We took up the entire hotel. Hotel was spotless, very accommodating to our needs, and most welcoming. They provided each person in our group a tourist map of Venice (a nice keepsake type map, not a cheap one!). The breakfast was sufficient and the proximity to the central train station was fantastic. We were able to walk our entire group of 32 with luggage on cobblestone in about 4 minutes. The main attractions in Venice (St. Marks, Doge's, etc) are about a 30 minute walk, but there is so much to see along the way, that it is certainly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for being in the center of things”
Reviews.Author: potatofish
Reviews.Content: Down a cute alleyway, off one of the more heavily trafficked part of Venice. Only a few hundred yards from train station. Very quaint. Rooms actually moderately sized and our bathroom was quite large. Everything cleaned nicely. Don't leave the balcony door open though....there are mosquitos in Venice! Staff all family and VERY friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, super clean.”
Reviews.Author: TurnLeftandKeepGoing
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the Hotel Caprera. (We stayed for 3 nights in March in a double room on the third floor). Our room was clean, tastefully decorated (modern, not chintzy), warm and light. The location is perfect as a 10 min walk from the bus station and a 4 min walk from the main water taxi station. The owners are lovely people who obviously take great pride in running a good hotel. It was great, we loved it, would definitely stay there again. If you do stay in this area, there are several lovely restaurants on the Rio Della Misericordia (including the excellent Paradiso perduto) and La Cantina on Strada Nova is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay at this intimate family hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrstraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service by staff at all times The room we had was spacious and spotless - the beds were not the most modern kind but we had lovely, fresh sheets daily Breakfast was modest but enough : coffee, juice, cake, rolls, cheese, ceral, etc served in the pleasant reception area The location is a 5 min walk from the car park entrance to Venice - very helpful for luggage but not in the centre of town. This will also save stiff ferry tickets there and back We were very happy with the room and service - the price was fair and I would certainly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “relatively budget in the venice Lagoon and friendly location”
Reviews.Author: PuneetDhar
Reviews.Content: One of the cheapest options available for net booking, in this EXPENSIVE city of Venice on the lagoon/ islands itself. All the other cheap options or even multinational brands (except Hilton) are on the mainland like Mestre, treviso or the airport. Since the charm of Venice is the location itself, this is a reasonable choice with walking distance from train station and almost also the bus station (Piazzale Roma) and yet walk to the canals! Despite the location in the lagoon itself not being central, and the hotel itself being on a tiny sidestreet (look hard at every alley on your left while going from the station end of lista di spagna). Very close to the jewish ghetto - which is actually a charming and different area to stroll around in. Also close to the vaporetti (water buses) stops and the cheapest souvenir shops in Venice - including one for paintings and tapestries. Hoever the friendly staff more than make up for the rather dingy appearance and despite the dodgy windows with locks (!) it is rather a safe locality. Internet for free, a sparse but adequate european style cold breakfast and help with maps etc was an additional plus. However in this beautiful city nicer to stay ON a canal with a room with a view to die for, and save up budgeting for the rest of the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, well-located small hotel run by excellent hoteliers, the Bico family.”
Reviews.Author: sodalime
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful quiet small hotel located close to the train station. Our room on the top floor was large, spotless, well-appointed. Bathroom the same. WiFI in our room. Breakfast was very good. The Bico family were most accommodating when we were stuck in Venice because of the Iceland volcanic cloud. They recommended an excellent travel agency close by in the Ghetto, Magic Touch Travel Service, where Igor Korman made excellent suggestions. Easy to walk anywhere you want to go. Highly recommended at very reasonable rate for Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: parag385
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a walking distance from the venice main train station - Santa Lucia, which is the city center. I took a single room. The rooms are of very small size. There is hardly any space in the room left after the bed and the chair in the room. All the rooms in this hotel have attached bathroom. You have the option of talking the room with breakfast and without breakfast. The family managing the hotel are very warm and friendly. They also provide free services like internet, room to keep your luggage after the checkout etc. Looking at the prices of other hotels in venice and also the location of the hotel, I will definately be staying in this hotel on my future visits as well. I would recommend this hotel on the basis of it location, attached bathroom, nice family managing the hotel and the prices of other hotel in venice (other hotels are expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel in expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: Alexey123456
Reviews.Content: This is a one star hotel so you should not demand too much. Surprisingly the cost of a four star hotel in Rimini was way lower!! Caprera is just a short walk from the train station so you can save a lot on water taxi which is expensive. It is also close to shops and the Grand Canal. The room was relatively big (for Venice) and had a small terrace. But the accomodation is really basic. The bad thing is that the room was smelly (which is common for Venice), old window frames (I'd say ancient) would not close and AC had quite a bit of dust on it. Thus I did not have a feeling of cleanliness staying there. To be honest I need to admit that contrary to the room the bathroom was really renovated and clean. The breakfast was close to nothing - cold coffee and cereals. The staff was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Great Value, Nice Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saintlouie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the 2007 Carnevale. The hotel was spotless, the rooms were quite large by European standards (let alone Venetian standards), as was the bath, and the price was well below other hotels in Venice, especially during Carnevale. The family that runs the hotel (and their cute dog who greets travelers in the lobby), are extremely nice and accomodating. It's a two-minute walk from the train station, which is convenenient upon arrival, but a bit far from the major sites. This wasn't a problem for us. Venice is for walking and exploring. We loved it here and would stay here agan.

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe, affordable location”
Reviews.Author: sandcake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in Venice here and we didn't know what to expect other than what we read on tripadvisor. We had to drag our suitcases on uneven pavement and steps across the bridge to get to the hotel because we took the affordable route on the bus. It is a good thing that the hotel was not too far from the bridge. The bridge is the only walkable entrance into Venice with many, many steps. Even if you take the boattaxi you still would have to drag suitcase across uneven pavement, so always book hotel close to bridge and you could always do sightseeing via walking afterwards. You can walk the entire city in 1 day. Check in was easy and staff friendly. Hotel is wood floor and poor insulation so we could hear footsteps/echo of our neighbors returning at night. Room was clean and small but engulfed by large 2 twin beds pushed together, 2 night stands, bureau, desk, 2 chairs, TV, and remodeled bathroom with bathub w/ showerhead but no shower curtain/door, toilet, bidet, sink, toilet and radiator. Our bathroom window was opened all night and we didn't know this, so when we woke up there were many mosquitoes that had bitten us all night. We were scratching for the rest of our trip. Wish the hotel had told us. We had to give our key to front desk whenever we left. Hotel had an internet store connecting to hotel for a fee. Restuarants, stores, ATMs, etc. surrounded this place. Venice is awesome...romantic, safe, friendly, pizza and gelato galore, and very, very touristy. Almost all the shops are family owned and items are handmade. Bakeries are the best in the world...better than Paris. All we ate was Pizza and gelato. We would love to return to Venice one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsbr2005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in May. The hotel is extremely clean & quiet (except for the birds in the morning). We stayed on the 2nd floor and the room did not have air conditioning, which would have been nice. A fan was in the room though. Breakfast was served downstairs every morning. They provided cold cereal, bread, yogurt, coffee, and juice. The staff was all extremely friendly and very helpful. They had great suggestions for restaurants and routes to take for the buses and water buses. The closest water bus stop is Ferrovia which is right near Pizzale Roma (train & bus station). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great and affordable stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Solarain
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel, we decided to book there. We were not disappointed! The hotel was very clean, very comfortable, very friendly and a great location. The room was small but quite adequate. The bed did not sag and was quite comfortable, the bathroom updated & spotless. The sheets were crisp and sweet. The only thing we weren't completely happy with was the breakfast, but for $5 euro, you can't complain. Try eating anywhere else in Venice for under $10 (or lots more!!). They provided dry cereal, milk, juice, French bread, butter, jam, and yogurt. They brought fresh hot tea or coffee. And the milk they brought for use with the coffee was steamed. The coffee itself was wonderful! The staff was always very helpful & friendly, giving information on close by grocery stores or whatever we asked. Just beware of advice of restaurants. Research them on your own. The hotel is just 1/2 block from the main street by the train station, but the noise from the street was not heard at all! We would definitely stay here again if we wanted to return.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Franeczka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the Carnival. The room we got with my mum was very small (single with buck beds) but very clean! The bathroom was tiny but sufficient - clean floor, shower, washbasin, towels, linen! The rooom was equipped with a small TV set too (though we had no time to watch anything:) Everything looks new! The hotel is very close to the railway station, which is good when carrying heavy luggage. It's 20 minutes from St Mark's Square (on foot) - nice walk (though not during Venetian Carnival). The owners were very friendly and helpful (we asked for some hot water in the evening). They serve continental breakfast (fresh rolls & croissant, cornflakes, coffee). You can also leave your luggage for some time after check-out and continue sight-seeing till your train arrival. Generally, I prefer self-catering accomodation but this hotel is very nice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Caprera
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 219, 30121 Venice, Italy
